name: Institution of Occupational Safety and Health
goal:
IOSH is the Chartered body for health and safety professionals. We are a registered charity and an international NGO (recognised by the ILO). We have over 47,000 members in over 130 countries worldwide.

As the world's biggest professional health and safety membership organisation, we're the voice of the profession, campaigning on issues that affect millions of working people. We set standards and support, develop and connect our members with resources, guidance, events and training.

Our vision - "A safe and healthy world of work" is one galvanising goal.

Our strategy (WORK 2022) defines how we will lead our profession and collaborate with our stakeholders towards achieving it. This is a strategy and plan of action that should make a real difference to the lives of people at work around the world. As a leading organisation in the occupational safety and health profession, a respected partner in business and management, and a respected organisation with global reach, our strategy will help deliver advances in health and safety at work worldwide.
interests: Employment and Social Affairs, Public Health, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
Our six priority areas include:
1. Preventing non-health-related fatalities
2. Preventing occupational cancers
3. Preventing musculoskeletal disorders (MSDs)
4. Promoting wellbeing (mental and physical health)
5. Promoting rehabilitation and return to work
6. Promoting sustainability and human capital

And we continue to promote work to address:
- OSH and older workers
- New and emerging OSH risks
- OSH education and competence across Europe
- EU OSH framework strategy
- OSH and vulnerable workers and support for SMEs
